Retiree medical benefits coordinated with Medicare and other governmental and employer benefit plans; voluntary early retirement incentive plans maintained by local educational agencies. "A voluntary early retirement incentive plan maintained by a local educational agency in coordination with a defined benefit plan maintained by a state or agency thereof is amended under the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967." The text discusses the coordination of retiree medical benefits with Medicare benefits under the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967. It clarifies that a voluntary early retirement incentive plan maintained by a local educational agency in coordination with a defined benefit plan maintained by a state or agency thereof is deemed to constitute a defined benefit plan for purposes of the Act. Section 4(l) of the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 is amended to state that it is not a violation if an employee benefit plan alters, reduces, or eliminates medical benefits for retired participants when they are eligible for Medicare benefits. The amendments made by subsections (a) and (b) apply to determining violations of employee benefit plans providing medical benefits for retired participants under the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967. The amendment made by subsection (a) addresses violations of employee benefit plans providing medical benefits for retired participants under the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967, specifically related to defined benefit plans. The amendment in subsection (a) addresses whether a voluntary early retirement incentive plan maintained by a local educational agency is considered a defined benefit plan for purposes including the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967.
